text:
Suspect accused of following elderly man home, stealing car at gunpoint
GREEN TOWNSHIP, Ohio (WXIX) - A Green Township man is accused of following a senior citizen home, robbing him of his car at gunpoint, and leading police on a chase.
27-year-old Mark Adams is facing charges of aggravated burglary, aggravated robbery, and fleeing police.
Green Township police say Adams followed an elderly man home from a Kroger on Glenway Avenue Tuesday.
When the victim parked his car in his attached garage and got out, police say that Adams pointed a gun at him and stole his car.
After the victim called 911, police put out an alert about the stolen car. Officers say they saw Adams driving the stolen car a short time later and started following him.
Officers say they had to stop chasing Adams because he was driving recklessly and putting people’s lives at risk.
They later found the stolen car parked behind a house Adams stayed at, according to police.
Police state that they also found documents with the victim’s name on them inside that house.
Adams is at the Hamilton County Detention Center on a $$300,000 bond.
